001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
002
003import com.badlogic.gdx.Application;
004import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
005import com.badlogic.gdx.LifecycleListener;
006import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Texture;
007import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.BitmapFont;
008import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureAtlas;
009import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
010import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
011import squidpony.squidmath.StatefulRNG;
012
013/**
014 * Default BitmapFonts, a sample image, "stretchable" fonts and icons, and a central RNG for use with libGDX.
015 * All but one of the resources here need to be downloaded separately, to avoid bloating the size of the dependency jar
016 * with many fonts that a game probably won't use. You can download assets in a jar with a release of SquidLib, or
017 * individually from https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/tree/master/assets . The assets you choose should go in the
018 * android/assets (core/assets if you don't have an Android project) subfolder of your game if you use the normal libGDX
019 * setup tool or SquidSetup, or the assets subfolder if you use czyzby's alternate setup tool,
020 * https://github.com/czyzby/gdx-setup . They should not be placed in subdirectories of assets, otherwise this won't be
021 * able to find them.
022 * <br>
023 * The fonts provided are mostly monospaced, with most looking rather similar (straight orthogonal lines and right-angle
024 * curves), but some that look... better than the rest. For monospaced fonts that could be used on a grid in SquidPanel
025 * or SquidLayers, it is recommended that you use a "stretchable" font (which use a signed distance field, or SDF,
026 * effect to stretch smoothly) or a "crisp" font (which use a multi-channel signed distance field, or MSDF, effect to
027 * stretch smoothly and remain sharp at very high zooms). For some usage you may want a TextFamily instead of a normal
028 * TextCellFactory or BitmapFont; these TextFamily fonts store regular, bold, italic, and bold-italic faces in one file,
029 * and {@link GDXMarkup} can produce text that will render in those faces. Some good choices for fonts here are
030 * Iosevka, which comes in a sans-serif version with {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, {@link #getCrispLeanFont()}, 
031 * {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}, and more, as well as a slab-serif version with {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()},
032 * {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, and {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}, among others, as well as Inconsolata-LGC, which is
033 * more geometric sans-serif accessible with {@link #getStretchableFont()}, or (well-suited for square glyphs)
034 * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} (it does not have a crisp variety). Another is Computer Modern, accessible by
035 * {@link #getStretchableTypewriterFont()}, which has a chunky, ornamented style. For variable-width fonts
036 * that can be used in TextPanel, among others, you can use the recommended crisp font family Noto Serif
037 * with {@link #getCrispPrintFamily()}, or for stretchable fonts there's the serif font Gentium with
038 * {@link #getStretchablePrintFont()} or Noto Sans with {@link #getStretchableCleanFont()} (Noto Sans currently has
039 * problems that Noto Serif does not have). All of the fonts so far support the Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic alphabets.
040 * <br>
041 * If you can't decide, go with {@link #getCrispLeanFont()} or {@link #getCrispSlabFont()}, which return TextCellFactory
042 * objects, and call their .width(int), .height(int), and .initBySize() methods to make them the size (and aspect ratio)
043 * you want. You can use stretchable or crisp fonts with equal width and height to make
044 * a horizontally-stretched version of a square font instead of the existing square fonts that add blank space.
045 * <br>
046 * The most Latin script support for a monospaced font is in the font Mandrill, accessible by getDefaultUnicodeFont()
047 * and getLargeUnicodeFont() in two different sizes, and the latter should be suitable for everything from Spanish and
048 * French, to Polish to Vietnamese. You can use Gentium for even better language support with a variable-width font in
049 * TextPanel or the like; it is accessible with getStretchablePrintFont(). Google's Noto font also supports many glyphs
050 * in a variable-width format; it is accessible with getStretchableCleanFont() but may have some issues with baseline
051 * level changing and character-to-character alignment seeming too high or low.
052 * <br>
053 * The sample image is a tentacle taken from a public domain icon collection graciously released by Henrique Lazarini;
054 * it's fitting for SquidLib to have a tentacle as a logo or something, I guess?
055 * <br>
056 * The icons are from http://game-icons.net , there are over 2000 of them, and they're among the only images that should
057 * both be recolor-able easily (like chars in a font) and resize-able easily if you use a stretchable font at the same
058 * time. The stretchable font TextCellFactories do some work with shaders that makes most images look incorrect, but
059 * allow distance field fonts and these distance field icons to resize smoothly. Mixing stretchable fonts with
060 * non-stretchable images or fonts is not a great idea, and usually involves a slow shader change back and forth.
061 * <br>
062 * You can get a default RNG with getGuiRandom(); this should probably not be reused for non-GUI-related randomness,
063 * but is meant instead to be used wherever randomized purely-aesthetic effects are needed, such as a jiggling effect.
064 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/11/2015.
065 */
066public class DefaultResources implements LifecycleListener {

150    public static final String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
151            + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
152            + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
153            + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
154            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
155            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
156            + "\n"
157            + "void main() {\n"
158            + " v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
159            + " v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
160            + " v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
161            + " gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
162            + "}\n";
163
164    public static final String fragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
165            + " precision mediump float;\n"
166            + " precision mediump int;\n"
167            + "#endif\n"
168            + "\n"
169            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
170            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
171            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
172            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
173            + "\n"
174            + "void main() {\n"
175            + "  if (u_smoothing > 0.0) {\n"
176            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000125, v_texCoords+0.000125);\n"
177            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).a) +\n"
178            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).a) +\n"
179            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).a) +\n"
180            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).a);\n"
181            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, ((smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).a) + 0.5 * asum) / 3.0) * v_color.a);\n"
182            + "  } else {\n"
183            + "         gl_FragColor = v_color * texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords);\n"
184            + "  }\n"
185            + "}\n";

193//            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"

195//            + "\n"

205    public static final String msdfFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
206            + " precision mediump float;\n"
207            + " precision mediump int;\n"
208            + "#endif\n"
209            + "\n"
210            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
211            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
212            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
213            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
214            + "\n"
215            + "void main() {\n"
216            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
217            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) * u_smoothing + 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
218            + "}\n";

225            //+ "       gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, alpha * v_color.a);\n"
226

231            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).rgb;\n"
232            //+ "  asum = asum + clamp((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.5) / (6.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.5, 0.0, 0.5); +\n"
233            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).rgb;\n"

235            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).rgb;\n"

237            //+ "  sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
238            //+ "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, clamp(((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.625) / (3.0 * u_smoothing) + 0.625 + asum) / 3.0, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
239            //+ "}\n";
240    /**
241     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#fragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around characters.
242     * Only works with distance field fonts. You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would
243     * look like {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.outlineFragmentShader)}, and
244     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
245     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
246     */
247    public static final String outlineFragmentShader = "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
248            + "precision mediump float;\n"
249            + "precision mediump int;\n"
250            + "#endif\n"
251            + "\n"
252            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
253            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
254            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
255            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
256            + "\n"
257            + "void main() {\n"
258            + "  if(u_smoothing <= 0.0) {\n"
259            + "    float smoothing = -u_smoothing;\n"
260            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000125, v_texCoords+0.000125);\n"
261            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
262            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
263            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
264            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
265            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
266            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
267            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
268            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
269            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
270            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - smoothing, 0.5 + smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y)));\n"
271            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb, (asum / 3.0) * v_color.a);\n"
272            + "  } else {\n"
273            + "    vec2 radistance = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
274            + "    float distance = min(radistance.x, radistance.y);\n"
275//            + "          vec2 box = vec2(0.0, 0.00375 * (u_smoothing + 0.0825));\n"
276//            + "          float asum = 0.7 * (smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, distance) + \n"
277//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.xy).a) +\n"
278//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.xy).a) +\n"
279//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords + box.yx).a) +\n"
280//            + "                   smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords - box.yx).a)),\n"
281            + "    vec4 box = vec4(v_texCoords-0.000625, v_texCoords+0.000625);\n"
282            + "    vec2 sample0 = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).ra;\n"
283            + "    vec2 sample1 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xy).ra;\n"
284            + "    vec2 sample2 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zw).ra;\n"
285            + "    vec2 sample3 = texture2D(u_texture, box.xw).ra;\n"
286            + "    vec2 sample4 = texture2D(u_texture, box.zy).ra;\n"
287            + "    float asum = smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample0.x, sample0.y)) + 0.5 * (\n"
288            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample1.x, sample1.y)) +\n"
289            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample2.x, sample2.y)) +\n"
290            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample3.x, sample3.y)) +\n"
291            + "                 smoothstep(0.5 - u_smoothing, 0.5 + u_smoothing, min(sample4.x, sample4.y))),\n"
292//            + "                 char = step(distance, 0.35);\n"
293            + "                 fancy = step(0.55, distance);\n"
294//            + "                 outline = clamp((distance * 0.8 - 0.415) * 18.0, 0.0, 1.0);\n"
295            + "    gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * fancy, (asum + step(0.3, distance)) * v_color.a);\n"
296            + "  }\n"
297            + "}\n";
298    /**
299     * An alternate shader based on {@link DefaultResources#msdfFragmentShader}, but this draws outlines around
300     * characters. This should be sharper than {@link #outlineFragmentShader},  but only works with MSDF (crisp) fonts.
301     * Unlike that shader, this doesn't have special behavior for negative
302     * {@link TextCellFactory#getSmoothingMultiplier()} values, though that may be added later.
303     * You probably need to create a new ShaderProgram to use this, which would look like
304     * {@code new ShaderProgram(DefaultResources.vertexShader, DefaultResources.msdfOutlineFragmentShader)}, and
305     * would assign this to your TextCellFactory's {@link TextCellFactory#shader} field after the TextCellFactory is
306     * fully initialized (calling {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()}) will set the shader back to the default).
307     */
308    public static final String msdfOutlineFragmentShader =  "#ifdef GL_ES\n"
309            + " precision mediump float;\n"
310            + " precision mediump int;\n"
311            + "#endif\n"
312            + "\n"
313            + "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n"
314            + "uniform float u_smoothing;\n"
315            + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
316            + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
317            + "\n"
318            + "void main() {\n"
319            + "  vec3 sdf = texture2D(u_texture, v_texCoords).rgb;\n"
320//            + "  float distance = (max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b)) - 0.425);\n"
321//            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(step(3.5 * u_smoothing, distance * 0.75) * v_color.rgb, clamp((distance / (3.4 * u_smoothing)) + 0.9125, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
322
323            //+ "  float cd = clamp(distance, 0.0, 1.0);"
324
325            + "  float d = ((max(min(sdf.r, sdf.g), min(max(sdf.r, sdf.g), sdf.b))) - 0.4);\n"
326            + "  float block = step(-0.4999999, d);\n"
327            + "  float nice = step(0.24999999, d);\n"
328            + "  gl_FragColor = vec4(v_color.rgb * nice, clamp(d * u_smoothing + (block + 1.0) * 0.5, 0.0, 1.0) * v_color.a);\n"
329            + "}\n";
330
331    private SquidColorCenter scc;
332    private Texture tentacle;
333    private TextureRegion tentacleRegion;
334    private StatefulRNG guiRandom;
335
336    private static DefaultResources instance;
337
338    static BitmapFont copyFont(BitmapFont font)
339    {
340        if(font == null) return new BitmapFont();
341        return new BitmapFont(new BitmapFont.BitmapFontData(font.getData().getFontFile(), false),
342                font.getRegions(), font.usesIntegerPositions());
343    }
344    private DefaultResources()
345    {
346        if(Gdx.app == null)
347            throw new IllegalStateException("Gdx.app cannot be null; initialize GUI-using objects in create() or later.");
348        Gdx.app.addLifecycleListener(this);
349    }
350
351    private static void initialize()
352    {
353        if(instance == null)
354            instance = new DefaultResources();
355    }
356
357    /**
358     * Gets the one font guaranteed to be included in libGDX, which is Arial at size 15 px.
359     * @return the BitmapFont representing Arial.ttf at size 15 px
360     */
361    public static BitmapFont getIncludedFont()
362    {
363        initialize();
364        if(instance.arial15 == null)
365        {
366            try {
367                instance.arial15 = new BitmapFont();
368                //instance.narrow1.getData().padBottom = instance.narrow1.getDescent();
369            } catch (Exception ignored) {
370            }
371        }
372        return copyFont(instance.arial15);
373    }
374    /**
375     * Returns a 12x12px, stretched but curvaceous font as an embedded resource. Caches it for later calls.
376     * <br>
377     * Needs files:
378     * <ul>
379     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.fnt</li>
380     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Zodiac-Square-12x12.png</li>
381     * </ul>
382     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Zodiac-Square.ttf at size 16 pt
383     */
384    public static BitmapFont getDefaultFont()
385    {
386        initialize();
387        if(instance.square1 == null)
388        {
389            try {
390                instance.square1 = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(squareName), Gdx.files.internal(squareTexture), false);
391                //instance.square1.getData().padBottom = instance.square1.getDescent();
392            } catch (Exception ignored) {
393            }
394        }
395        return copyFont(instance.square1);
396    }

588    /**
589     * Returns a 25x25px, very smooth and generally good-looking font (based on Inconsolata) as an embedded resource.
590     * This font fully supports Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and of particular interest to SquidLib, Box Drawing characters.
591     * This variant is (almost) perfectly square, and box drawing characters should line up at size 25x25 px, but other
592     * glyphs will have much more horizontal spacing than in other fonts. Caches the font for later calls. You may want
593     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()} instead, which is the same font but can stretch smoothly to most sizes.
594     * <br>
595     * Needs files:
596     * <ul>
597     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.fnt</li>
598     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-25x25.png</li>
599     * </ul>
600     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Inconsolata-LGC-Square at size 25x25 pixels
601     */
602    public static BitmapFont getSquareSmoothFont()
603    {
604        initialize();
605        if(instance.smoothSquare == null)
606        {
607            try {
608                instance.smoothSquare = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(smoothSquareName), Gdx.files.internal(smoothSquareTexture), false);
609                //instance.smoothSquare.getData().padBottom = instance.smoothSquare.getDescent();
610            } catch (Exception ignored) {
611            }
612        }
613        return copyFont(instance.smoothSquare);
614    }

617     * The font builds on work by Christian Munk in his font called Monotwist, making some changes for legibility.
618     * This font has the lowest width of any font asset distributed with SquidLib. Caches the font for later calls.
619     * Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the
620     * license file linked below.
621     * <br>
622     * Needs files:
623     * <ul>
624     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-4x10.fnt</li>
625     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-4x10.png</li>
626     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-license.txt</li>
627     * </ul>
628     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Monty.ttf at size 8 pt
629     */

639            }

643    /**
644     * Returns a 8x20px, extremely thin font (that may be barely legible) as an embedded resource.
645     * The font builds on work by Christian Munk in his font called Monotwist, making some changes for legibility.
646     * A smaller version of this font, {@link #getTinyFont()}, has the lowest width of any font asset distributed with
647     * SquidLib; this doubles its resolution in case you like its appearance but don't want to go blind. Caches the font
648     * for later calls. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font;
649     * this is in the license file linked below.
650     * <br>
651     * Needs files:
652     * <ul>
653     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.fnt</li>
654     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-8x20.png</li>
655     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Monty-license.txt</li>
656     * </ul>
657     * @return the BitmapFont object representing Monty.ttf at size 16 pt
658     */

666            } catch (Exception ignored) {

671    /**
672     * Returns a 7x12px font with identical (excellent) Unicode coverage to Iosevka, as an embedded resource.
673     * The font is 7-12-serif by Christian Munk, but not all of the Unicode glyphs supported in his amazingly-huge font
674     * are present here; just the subset that's compatible with Iosevka (which is way more than is required for SquidLib
675     * to present most things). Caches the font for later calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of
676     * calling this method again, it won't stay monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk
677     * (or the username he used, CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
678     * <br>
679     * Needs files:
680     * <ul>
681     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.fnt</li>
682     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif.png</li>
683     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-license.txt</li>
684     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/7-12-serif-readme.txt</li>
685     * </ul>
686     * @return the BitmapFont object representing 7-12-serif.ttf at a size that gives exactly 7 px wide by 12 px tall
687     */
688    public static BitmapFont getSevenTwelveFont()
689    {
690        initialize();
691        if(instance.sevenTwelve == null)
692        {
693            try {
694                instance.sevenTwelve = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveName), Gdx.files.internal(sevenTwelveTexture), false);
695            } catch (Exception ignored) {
696            }
697        }
698        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.sevenTwelve);
699        cpy.setFixedWidthGlyphs(" !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmno\n" +
700                "pqrstuvwxyz{|}~\u00AD\n" +
701                "\n" +
702                "\n" +
703                "\n" +
704                "\n" +
705                "\n" +
706                "\n" +
707                "\n" +
708                "\n" +
709                "\n" +
710                "\n" +
711                "\n" +
712                "\n" +
713                "\n" +
714                "\n" +
715                "\n" +
716                "\n" +
717                "\n" +
718                "\n" +
719                "\n" +
720                "\n" +
721                "\n" +
722                "\n" +
723                "\n" +
724                "\n" +
725                "\n" +
726                "\n" +
727                "\n" +
728                "\u200B\u200C\u200D\u200E\u200F\u2028\u2029\u202A\u202B\u202C\u202D\u202E\n" +
729                "\u2060\u2061\u2062\u2063\u2064\u2066\u2067\u2068\u2069\u206A\u206B\u206C\u206D\u206E\u206F\n" +
730                "\n" +
731                "\n" +
732                "\n" +
733                "\n" +
734                "\n" +
735                "\n" +
736                "\n" +
737                "\n" +
738                "\n" +
739                "\n" +
740                "\n" +
741                "\n" +
742                "\n" +
743                "\n" +

760                "\n" +
761                "\n" +
762                "\n" +
763                "\n" +
764                "\n" +
765                "\n" +
766                "\n" +
767                "");
768        return cpy;

770    /**
771     * Returns a 14x27px font with fairly good Unicode coverage and an octagonal, angular look, as an embedded resource.
772     * The font is Computer Says No by Christian Munk, which has a nice clean appearance. Caches the font for later
773     * calls, but be aware that if you copy the BitmapFont instead of calling this method again, it won't stay
774     * monospaced because of a quirk of libGDX. Attribution to Christian Munk (or the username he used,
775     * CMunk) is required to use this font; this is in the license file linked below.
776     * <br>
777     * Needs files:
778     * <ul>
779     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.fnt</li>
780     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo.png</li>
781     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-license.txt</li>
782     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/ComputerSaysNo-readme.txt</li>
783     * </ul>
784     * @return the BitmapFont object representing ComputerSaysNo.ttf at a size that gives about 14 px wide by 27 px tall
785     */
786    public static BitmapFont getOctagonalMonoFont()
787    {
788        initialize();
789        if(instance.computerSaysNo == null)
790        {
791            try {
792                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoName), Gdx.files.internal(computerSaysNoTexture), false);
793            } catch (Exception e) {
794                instance.computerSaysNo = new BitmapFont();
795            }
796        }
797        final BitmapFont cpy = copyFont(instance.computerSaysNo);
798        // ugh, this shouldn't be required...
799        cpy.setFixedWidthGlyphs("\u0000" +
800                " !\"#$%&'()*+,-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\\]^_`abcdefghijklmno\n" +
801                "pqrstuvwxyz{|}~\u00AD\n" +
802                "\n" +
803                "\n" +
804                "\n" +
805                "\n" +
806                "\n" +
807                "\n" +
808                "\n" +
809                "\n" +
810                "\n" +
811                "\n" +
812                "\n" +
813                "\n" +
814                "\n" +
815                "\n" +
816                "\n" +
817                "\n" +
818                "\n" +
819                "\n" +
820                "\n" +
821                "\n" +
822                "\n" +
823                "\n" +
824                "\n" +
825                "\n" +
826                "\n" +
827                "\n" +
828                "\n" +
829                "\n" +
830                "\n" +
831                "\n" +
832                "\n" +
833                "");
834        return cpy;
835    }

840     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
841     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.
842     * <br>
843     * Needs files:
844     * <ul>
845     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Cozette.fnt</li>

847     * </ul>

857            } catch (Exception ignored) {

860        return copyFont(instance.cozette);

863    /**
864     * Returns a 7x14px pixel font with broad coverage of Unicode, including Greek, Cyrillic, Braille, and tech-related
865     * icons, with a black outline applied around the white inner strokes. The outline typically won't be colored when
866     * the rest of the font is, but the inner stroke changes color normally. The font is
867     * <a href="https://github.com/slavfox/Cozette">Cozette by slavfox</a>. Caches the font for later
868     * calls. Attribution is not required; Cozette is MIT-licensed, and we aren't distributing any of its files. Still,
869     * credit goes to slavfox for this nice, highly-usable font.
870     * <br>
871     * Using this font in a TextCellFactory is experimental; it should be usable in scene2d.ui widgets, though.
872     * <br>
873     * Needs files:
874     * <ul>
875     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.fnt</li>
876     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CozetteOutlined.png</li>
877     * </ul>
878     * @return the BitmapFont object representing CozetteVector.ttf at size 12 pt with a square outline applied
879     */
880    public static BitmapFont getCozyOutlinedFont()
881    {
882        initialize();
883        if(instance.cozetteOutlined == null)
884        {
885            try {
886                instance.cozetteOutlined = new BitmapFont(Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedName), Gdx.files.internal(cozetteOutlinedTexture), false);
887            } catch (Exception ignored) {
888            }
889        }
890        return copyFont(instance.cozetteOutlined);
891    }

893    /**
894     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches
895     * the result for later calls.
896     * <br>
897     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/DD1RkPa.png
898     * <br>
899     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
900     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
901     * <br>
902     * Needs files:
903     * <ul>
904     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.fnt</li>
905     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Inconsolata-LGC-Square-distance.png</li>
906     * </ul>
907     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font Inconsolata-LGC-Square.ttf
908     */
909    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSquareFont()
910    {
911        initialize();
912        if(instance.distanceSquare == null)
913        {
914            try {
915                instance.distanceSquare = new TextCellFactory().defaultDistanceFieldFont();
916            } catch (Exception ignored) {
917            }
918        }
919        if(instance.distanceSquare != null)
920            return instance.distanceSquare.copy();
921        return null;
922    }

924    /**
925     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an blocky, fairly-bold square font that should scale cleanly
926     * to many sizes. Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially,
927     * and is not a distorted/stretched version of an existing font. Caches the result for later calls.
928     * <br>
929     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
930     * <br>
931     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png">Preview at 6x6 size, https://i.imgur.com/nIjgTOp.png</a>
932     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png">Preview at much larger size, https://i.imgur.com/lWaSgVN.png</a>
933     * <br>
934     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
935     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
936     * <br>
937     * Needs files:
938     * <ul>
939     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.fnt</li>
940     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/BoxedIn-distance.png</li>
941     * </ul>
942     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the square font BoxedIn.ttf
943     */
944    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableHeavySquareFont()
945    {
946        initialize();
947        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare == null)
948        {
949            try {
950                instance.distanceHeavySquare = new TextCellFactory()
951                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldHeavySquare, distanceFieldHeavySquareTexture)
952                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(2.125f);
953            } catch (Exception ignored) {
954            }
955        }
956        if(instance.distanceHeavySquare != null)
957            return instance.distanceHeavySquare.copy();
958        return null;
959    }

961    /**
962     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use an all-caps (with lighter-weight versions of upper-case
963     * letters for the lower-case glyphs) square font that should scale cleanly to many sizes.
964     * Unlike {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
965     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, and as said before, it doesn't
966     * have separate lower-case letters. Note: if you use this font as-is, most characters will overlap slightly with
967     * each other, which can be an aesthetic benefit in some styles but can also be hard to read, at least if the colors
968     * aren't different between overlapping characters. For that reason, you may want to tweak the width and height of
969     * this font after passing it to a SquidLayers or SparseLayers; often you would pass 0.875 times the original
970     * width and height to {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} and {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)}.
971     * Caches the result for later calls. The font is "square" by Wouter van Oortmerssen; it is available under a
972     * CC-BY-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Wouter van Oortmerssen if you use it.
973     * <br>
974     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 6f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
975     * <br>
976     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
977     * <br>
978     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
979     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
980     * <br>
981     * Needs files:
982     * <ul>
983     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.fnt</li>
984     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-msdf.png</li>
985     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/square-License.txt</li>
986     * </ul>
987     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font square.ttf
988     */
989    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCurvySquareFont()
990    {
991        initialize();
992        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare == null)
993        {
994            try {
995                instance.msdfCurvySquare = new TextCellFactory()
996                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCurvySquare, crispCurvySquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(6f);
997            } catch (Exception ignored) {
998            }
999        }
1000        if(instance.msdfCurvySquare != null)
1001            return instance.msdfCurvySquare.copy();
1002        return null;
1003    }

1005    /**
1006     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a square font with 45-degree angled sections, based on the
1007     * typeface used on the Atari ST console, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Unlike
1008     * {@link #getStretchableSquareFont()}, the font this uses was made to be square initially, and is not a
1009     * distorted/stretched version of an existing font. This font only supports ASCII, but it supports all of it, unlike
1010     * {@link #getCrispCurvySquareFont()}. Caches the result for later calls. The font is "a-starry", based on "Atari ST
1011     * (low-res)" by Damien Guard; it is available under a CC-BY-SA-3.0 license, which requires attribution to Damien
1012     * Guard (and technically Tommy Ettinger, because he made changes in a-starry) if you use it.
1013     * <br>
1014     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 3f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1015     * <br>
1016     * <a href="https://i.imgur.com/nvHl64v.png">Preview at large size</a>
1017     * <br>
1018     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1019     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1020     * <br>
1021     * Needs files:
1022     * <ul>
1023     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.fnt</li>
1024     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-msdf.png</li>
1025     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/a-starry-license.txt</li>
1026     * </ul>
1027     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font a-starry.ttf
1028     */
1029    public static TextCellFactory getCrispOctagonalSquareFont()
1030    {
1031        initialize();

1034            try {

1036                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispOctagonalSquare, crispOctagonalSquareTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(3f);
1037            } catch (Exception ignored) {

1039        }

1041            return instance.msdfOctagonalSquare.copy();
1042        return null;
1043    }

1111    /**
1112     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with broad Unicode support
1113     * that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Source Code Pro, an
1114     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has good Unicode support among the fixed-width
1115     * fonts used by SquidLib. It may be a good choice for science-fiction games because of its modern feel, but the
1116     * legibility enhancements made so the font could be usable in text editors also are nice for all text-based games.
1117     * The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly
1118     * pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 15 and cell height of 27 is ideal;
1119     * this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.
1120     * <br>
1121     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/VC0xn2r.png
1122     * <br>
1123     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1124     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1125     * <br>
1126     * Needs files:
1127     * <ul>
1128     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.fnt</li>
1129     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceCodePro-Medium-distance.png</li>
1130     * </ul>
1131     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceCodePro-Medium.otf
1132     */
1133    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeFont()
1134    {
1135        initialize();
1136        if(instance.distanceCode == null)
1137        {
1138            try {
1139                instance.distanceCode = new TextCellFactory()
1140                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCode, distanceFieldCodeTexture);
1141            } catch (Exception e) {
1142                e.printStackTrace();
1143            }
1144        }
1145        if(instance.distanceCode != null)
1146            return instance.distanceCode.copy();
1147        return null;
1148    }
1149    /**
1150     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with strong CJK support (in
1151     * particular, very good coverage for Japanese) that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1152     * calls. The font used is Source Han Code JP, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Adobe, and it has
1153     * the best CJK char support among the fonts used by SquidLib. It is extremely wide if used only for English text,
1154     * which may be desirable to make square cells. The very high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1155     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1156     * width of 19 and cell height of 20 is ideal; this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes.
1157     * <br>
1158     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.125f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1159     * <br>
1160     * Preview: https://i.imgur.com/g65jXxB.png
1161     * <br>
1162     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1163     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1164     * <br>
1165     * Needs files:
1166     * <ul>
1167     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.fnt</li>
1168     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/SourceHanCodeJP-Regular-distance.png</li>
1169     * </ul>
1170     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font SourceHanCodeJP-Regular.otf
1171     */
1172    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCodeJPFont()
1173    {
1174        initialize();
1175        if(instance.distanceCodeJP == null)
1176        {
1177            try {
1178                instance.distanceCodeJP = new TextCellFactory()
1179                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldCodeJP, distanceFieldCodeJPTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.125f);
1180            } catch (Exception e) {
1181                e.printStackTrace();
1182            }
1183        }
1184        if(instance.distanceCodeJP != null)
1185            return instance.distanceCodeJP.copy();
1186        return null;
1187    }
1188    /**
1189     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1190     * and a thin, geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font
1191     * used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1192     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1193     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1194     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1195     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1196     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1197     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1198     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1199     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif
1200     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1201     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and
1202     * {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}.
1203     * <br>
1204     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/sm0ULbU.png
1205     * <br>
1206     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1207     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1208     * <br>
1209     * Needs files:
1210     * <ul>
1211     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.fnt</li>
1212     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-distance.png</li>
1213     * </ul>
1214     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf
1215     */
1216    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableLeanFont()
1217    {
1218        initialize();
1219        if(instance.distanceLean == null)
1220        {
1221            try {
1222                instance.distanceLean = new TextCellFactory()
1223                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldLean, distanceFieldLeanTexture);
1224            } catch (Exception e) {
1225                e.printStackTrace();
1226            }
1227        }
1228        if(instance.distanceLean != null)
1229            return instance.distanceLean.copy();
1230        return null;
1231    }

1233    /**
1234     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1235     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The
1236     * font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1237     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1238     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1239     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1240     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1241     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1242     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1243     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1244     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1245     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1246     * also versions of Iosevka that use a Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()} and

1252     * distance field font technique this uses can work.

1258     * </ul>

1270                e.printStackTrace();
1271            }
1272        }
1273        if(instance.distanceSlab != null)
1274            return instance.distanceSlab.copy();
1275        return null;

1277    /**
1278     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1279     * and a very thin, geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The
1280     * font used is Iosevka (at Light weight), an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1281     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1282     * process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also
1283     * circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count means the part of the
1284     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1285     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1286     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1287     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1288     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this sans-serif version of Iosevka and the slab-serif
1289     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableSlabLightFont()}, though they have subtly different sizes. There are
1290     * also versions of Iosevka that do not use this Light weight, available by {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()} and
1291     * {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}.

1322    /**
1323     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1324     * and a very thin, slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later
1325     * calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style at Light weight, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface
1326     * by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to
1327     * Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1328     * Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters. The high glyph count
1329     * means the part of the image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts
1330     * small and is resized to much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate
1331     * multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an
1332     * aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A
1333     * tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab
1334     * serifs and the other version SquidLib has, {@link #getStretchableLeanLightFont()}, though they have subtly
1335     * different sizes. There are also versions of Iosevka that do not use this Light weight, available by
1336     * {@link #getStretchableLeanFont()} and {@link #getStretchableSlabFont()}.
1337     * <br>
1338     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/B5eSGfj.png
1339     * <br>
1340     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1341     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1342     * <br>
1343     * Needs files:
1344     * <ul>
1345     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.fnt</li>
1346     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Light-distance.png</li>
1347     * </ul>
1348     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab-Light.ttf
1349     */
1350    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableSlabLightFont()
1351    {
1352        initialize();
1353        if(instance.distanceSlabLight == null)
1354        {
1355            try {
1356                instance.distanceSlabLight = new TextCellFactory()
1357                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldSlabLight, distanceFieldSlabLightTexture);
1358            } catch (Exception e) {
1359                e.printStackTrace();
1360            }
1361        }
1362        if(instance.distanceSlabLight != null)
1363            return instance.distanceSlabLight.copy();
1364        return null;
1365    }
1366    
1367    /**
1368     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a font with extremely wide Unicode support that should scale
1369     * cleanly to many sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font is DejaVu Sans Mono, a common font on Linux
1370     * operating systems and a clean-looking, legible font, though it has some visual quirks like a "tail" on lower-case
1371     * 'l', that take some getting used to. A possible requirement for this font is that the size of the text in a
1372     * SquidPanel or SquidLayers may need to be increased 1-5 pixels past what the cell width and height are; this can
1373     * be done with {@link SquidPanel#setTextSize(float, float)} or {@link SquidLayers#setTextSize(float, float)},
1374     * giving 1-2 more than the cell width for x and 3-5 more than the cell height for y.
1375     * <br>
1376     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/1haETOe.png
1377     * <br>
1378     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1379     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1380     * <br>
1381     * Needs files:
1382     * <ul>
1383     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.fnt</li>
1384     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-distance.png</li>
1385     * </ul>
1386     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf
1387     */
1388    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableDejaVuFont()
1389    {
1390        initialize();
1391        if(instance.distanceDejaVu == null)
1392        {
1393            try {
1394                instance.distanceDejaVu = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldDejaVu, distanceFieldDejaVuTexture);
1395            } catch (Exception e) {
1396                e.printStackTrace();
1397            }
1398        }
1399        if(instance.distanceDejaVu != null)
1400            return instance.distanceDejaVu.copy();
1401        return null;
1402
1403    }
1404    /**
1405     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1406     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Meant to be used in variable-
1407     * width displays like TextPanel. Caches the result for later calls.
1408     * <br>
1409     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/eIYYt8C.png
1410     * <br>
1411     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1412     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1413     * <br>
1414     * Needs files:
1415     * <ul>
1416     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Gentium-distance.fnt</li>
1417     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Gentium-distance.png</li>
1418     * </ul>
1419     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Gentium, by SIL
1420     */
1421    public static TextCellFactory getStretchablePrintFont() {
1422        initialize();
1423        if (instance.distancePrint == null) {
1424            try {
1425                instance.distancePrint = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldPrint, distanceFieldPrintTexture)
1426                        .height(30).width(7);
1427                instance.distancePrint.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1428                
1429            } catch (Exception e) {
1430                e.printStackTrace();
1431            }
1432        }
1433        if(instance.distancePrint != null)
1434            return instance.distancePrint.copy();
1435        return null;
1436    }

1439     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font that should have a blocky,
1440     * futuristic look (based on the font Orbitron), and that should scale cleanly to many sizes. Meant to be used in
1441     * variable-width displays like TextPanel. Caches the result for later calls.
1442     * <br>

1451     * <ul>
1452     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Orbitron-distance.fnt</li>

1454     * </ul>
1455     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Orbitron, by The League of Movable Type
1456     */
1457    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableOrbitFont() {
1458        initialize();
1459        if (instance.distanceOrbit == null) {
1460            try {
1461                instance.distanceOrbit = new TextCellFactory().setDirectionGlyph('')
1462                        .fontDistanceField(distanceFieldOrbit, distanceFieldOrbitTexture)
1463                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.3f).height(30).width(11);
1464            } catch (Exception e) {
1465                e.printStackTrace();
1466            }
1467        }
1468        if(instance.distanceOrbit != null)
1469            return instance.distanceOrbit.copy();
1470        return null;
1471    }

1473    /**
1474     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font that currently looks
1475     * slightly jumbled without certain layout features. Meant to be used in variable-width displays like TextPanel, but
1476     * currently you should prefer getStretchablePrintFont() for legibility. Caches the result for later calls.
1477     * <br>
1478     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 0.8, instead of the default 1.2f. If you set the smoothing multiplier
1479     * yourself, it should be similarly smaller than what other fonts use (most fonts are 1.2, so multiplying whatever
1480     * you would normally set the smoothing multiplier to by 0.66f should work).
1481     * <br>
1482     * Preview: http://i.imgur.com/GF5qQxn.png
1483     * <br>
1484     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1485     * distance field font technique this uses can work.
1486     * <br>
1487     * Needs files:
1488     * <ul>
1489     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.fnt</li>
1490     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Noto-Sans-distance.png</li>
1491     * </ul>
1492     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Sans, by Google
1493     */
1494    public static TextCellFactory getStretchableCleanFont() {
1495        initialize();
1496        if (instance.distanceClean == null) {
1497            try {
1498                instance.distanceClean = new TextCellFactory().fontDistanceField(distanceFieldClean, distanceFieldCleanTexture)
1499                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(0.8f).height(30).width(5);
1500                instance.distanceClean.bmpFont.setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1501            } catch (Exception e) {
1502                e.printStackTrace();
1503            }
1504        }
1505        if(instance.distanceClean != null)
1506            return instance.distanceClean.copy();
1507        return null;
1508    }

1510    /**
1511     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support
1512     * and a slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1513     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1514     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1515     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin,
1516     * Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1517     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1518     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography
1519     * expert) called Iosevka
1520     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1521     * <br>
1522     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/YlzFEVX.png">Image link</a>
1523     * <br>
1524     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1525     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1526     * <br>
1527     * Needs files:
1528     * <ul>
1529     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.fnt</li>
1530     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-msdf.png</li>
1531     * </ul>
1532     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf using MSDF
1533     */
1534    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabFont()
1535    {
1536        initialize();
1537        if(instance.msdfSlab == null)
1538        {
1539            try {
1540                instance.msdfSlab = new TextCellFactory()
1541                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispSlab, crispSlabTexture);
1542            } catch (Exception e) {
1543                e.printStackTrace();
1544            }
1545        }
1546        if(instance.msdfSlab != null)
1547            return instance.msdfSlab.copy();
1548        return null;
1549    }
1550    /**
1551     * Not supported; use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead, using {@link GDXMarkup} to add italics with its
1552     * {@code [/]} tag.
1553     * @return always throws an UnsupportedOperationException
1554     * @deprecated use {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()} instead
1555     */
1556    @Deprecated
1557    public static TextCellFactory getCrispSlabItalicFont()
1558    {
1559        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Use getCrispSlabFamily() instead, with GDXMarkup to add italics.");
1560    }

1570     * expert) called Iosevka
1571     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>

1613    /**
1614     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width font with excellent Unicode support
1615     * and a humanist style, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1616     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Cascadia Code Mono, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1617     * License) typeface by Microsoft (see https://github.com/microsoft/cascadia-code ). It supports a lot of glyphs,
1618     * including most extended Latin (though it doesn't support a handful of chars used by  FakeLanguageGen), Greek,
1619     * Braille, and Cyrillic, but also the necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1620     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1621     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1622     * <br>
1623     *
1624     * <br>
1625     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1626     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1627     * <br>
1628     * Needs files:
1629     * <ul>
1630     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CascadiaMono-msdf.fnt</li>
1631     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/CascadiaMono-msdf.png</li>
1632     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Cascadia-license.txt</li>
1633     * </ul>
1634     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font CascadiaMono.ttf
1635     */
1636    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCascadiaFont()
1637    {
1638        initialize();
1639        if(instance.msdfCascadia == null)
1640        {
1641            try {
1642                instance.msdfCascadia = new TextCellFactory()
1643                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCascadia, crispCascadiaTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);
1644            } catch (Exception e) {
1645                e.printStackTrace();
1646            }
1647        }
1648        if(instance.msdfCascadia != null)
1649            return instance.msdfCascadia.copy();
1650        return null;
1651    }
1652    /**
1653     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width sans-serif font with excellent Unicode support,
1654     * that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls. The font used is DejaVu
1655     * Sans Mono, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface that is widely used by Linux distros and other groups.
1656     * It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also the
1657     * necessary box drawing characters. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the
1658     * normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow sharper edges. It has been updated so it is laid out
1659     * mostly-correctly now; some glyphs may be a little wide, such as {@code @}, but the line height, baseline, and the
1660     * width for most glyphs seem correct. If you find the box drawing characters don't line up, try 
1661     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} with values like 1.125f; the exact value may depend on size.
1662     * <br>
1663     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1664     * <br>
1665     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/SCwhduv.png">Image link</a>
1666     * <br>
1667     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1668     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1669     * <br>
1670     * Needs files:
1671     * <ul>
1672     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.fnt</li>
1673     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/DejaVuSansMono-msdf.png</li>
1674     * </ul>
1675     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font DejaVuSansMono.ttf with an MSDF effect
1676     */
1677    public static TextCellFactory getCrispDejaVuFont()
1678    {
1679        initialize();
1680        if(instance.msdfDejaVu == null)
1681        {
1682            try {
1683                instance.msdfDejaVu = new TextCellFactory()
1684                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispDejaVu, crispDejaVuTexture).setSmoothingMultiplier(1f);
1685            } catch (Exception e) {
1686                e.printStackTrace();
1687            }
1688        }
1689        if(instance.msdfDejaVu != null)
1690            return instance.msdfDejaVu.copy();
1691        return null;
1692    }
1693    
1694    /**
1695     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1696     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1697     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with Slab style, an open-source
1698     * (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several
1699     * customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs,
1700     * including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the
1701     * necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the
1702     * image for each glyph is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to
1703     * much larger. A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect
1704     * ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1705     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1706     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1707     * version SquidLib has, {@link #getLeanFamily()}.
1708     * <br>
1709     * <br>
1710     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1711     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1712     * <br>
1713     * Needs files:
1714     * <ul>
1715     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1716     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-distance.png</li>
1717     * </ul>
1718     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles
1719     */
1720    public static TextFamily getSlabFamily()
1721    {
1722        initialize();
1723        if(instance.familySlab == null)
1724        {
1725            try {
1726                instance.familySlab = new TextFamily().defaultFamilySlabDistance();
1727            } catch (Exception e) {
1728                e.printStackTrace();
1729            }
1730        }
1731        if(instance.familySlab != null)
1732            return instance.familySlab.copy();
1733        return null;
1734    }
1735    /**
1736     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1737     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1738     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an open-source (SIL Open Font
1739     * License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations
1740     * thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite
1741     * a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing
1742     * characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the part of the image for each glyph
1743     * is smaller, though, so this may look slightly pixelated if it starts small and is resized to much larger. A cell
1744     * width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the
1745     * font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert)
1746     * called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a>
1747     * You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has,
1748     * {@link #getSlabFamily()}.
1749     * <br>
1750     * <br>
1751     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1752     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1753     * <br>
1754     * Needs files:
1755     * <ul>
1756     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1757     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-distance.png</li>
1758     * </ul>
1759     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles
1760     */
1761    public static TextFamily getLeanFamily()

1767                instance.familyLean = new TextFamily().defaultFamilyLeanDistance();
1768            } catch (Exception e) {

1770            }
1771        }
1772        if(instance.familyLean != null)
1773            return instance.familyLean.copy();
1774        return null;
