1776    /**
1777     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a traditional
1778     * serif style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes and supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic,
1779     * and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Go Mono, a typeface released by the team
1780     * behind the Go programming language as open-source (3-clause BSD, the same license as the Go language; the license
1781     * is included with the assets). It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and
1782     * Cyrillic, bu also the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). There's more
1783     * information about this font available where it was introduced,
1784     * <a href="https://blog.golang.org/go-fonts">on the Go blog</a>.
1785     * You may want to try using this Go font family and contrasting it with Iosevka with and without slab serifs, which
1786     * are {@link #getSlabFamily()} and {@link #getLeanFamily()} respectively.
1787     * <br>
1788     * <br>
1789     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1790     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1791     * <br>
1792     * Needs files:
1793     * <ul>
1794     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.fnt</li>
1795     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-Family-distance.png</li>
1796     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/GoMono-License.txt</li>
1797     * </ul>
1798     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font GoMono.ttf with 4 styles
1799     */
1800    public static TextFamily getGoFamily()
1801    {
1802        initialize();
1803        if(instance.familyGo == null)
1804        {
1805            try {
1806                instance.familyGo = new TextFamily();
1807                instance.familyGo.fontDistanceField("GoMono-Family-distance.fnt", "GoMono-Family-distance.png");
1808            } catch (Exception e) {
1809                e.printStackTrace();
1810            }
1811        }
1812        if(instance.familyGo != null)
1813            return instance.familyGo.copy();
1814        return null;
1815    }
1816    /**
1817     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1818     * sans-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1819     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka, an
1820     * open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it 
1821     * uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot
1822     * of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and
1823     * the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture
1824     * that holds all four faces of the font is larger than normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices
1825     * to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets). A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some
1826     * approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using
1827     * Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed
1828     * Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips
1829     * on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a true typography expert) called Iosevka
1830     * <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that deserves an award."</a> You may want to
1831     * try using both this version of Iosevka without serifs and the other version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, 
1832     * {@link #getCrispSlabFamily()}.
1833     * <br>
1834     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/dMVzpEi.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1835     * <br>
1836     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1837     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1838     * <br>
1839     * Needs files:
1840     * <ul>
1841     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1842     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Family-msdf.png</li>
1843     * </ul>
1844     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1845     */
1846    public static TextFamily getCrispLeanFamily()
1847    {
1848        initialize();
1849        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF == null)
1850        {
1851            try {
1852                instance.familyLeanMSDF = new TextFamily();
1853                instance.familyLeanMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Family-msdf.png");
1854            } catch (Exception e) {
1855                e.printStackTrace();
1856            }
1857        }
1858        if(instance.familyLeanMSDF != null)
1859            return instance.familyLeanMSDF.copy();
1860        return null;
1861
1862    }
1863
1864    /**
1865     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a highly-legible fixed-width font with good Unicode support and a
1866     * slab-serif geometric style, that should scale cleanly to many sizes (using an MSDF technique) and supports 4
1867     * styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is Iosevka with
1868     * slab style, an open-source (SIL Open Font License) typeface by Belleve Invis (see
1869     * https://be5invis.github.io/Iosevka/ ), and it uses several customizations thanks to Iosevka's special build
1870     * process, applied to the 4 styles. It supports a lot of glyphs, including quite a bit of extended Latin, Greek,
1871     * and Cyrillic, but also circled letters and digits and the necessary box drawing characters (which line up even 
1872     * for italic text). The high glyph count means the texture that holds all four faces of the font is larger than
1873     * normal, at 4096x4096; this may be too large for some devices to load correctly (mostly older phones or tablets).
1874     * A cell width of 11 and cell height of 20 is ideal (or some approximate multiple of that aspect ratio); this
1875     * allows the font to resize fairly well to larger sizes using Viewports.  This uses the Multi-channel Signed
1876     * Distance Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed  Distance Field technique, which gives the
1877     * rendered font sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes. As an aside, Luc Devroye (a
1878     * true typography expert) called Iosevka <a href="http://luc.devroye.org/fonts-82704.html">"A tour de force that
1879     * deserves an award."</a> You may want to try using both this version of Iosevka with slab serifs and the other
1880     * version SquidLib has with an MSDF effect, {@link #getCrispLeanFamily()}.
1881     * <br>
1882     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.55f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1883     * <br>
1884     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/wRNlpL5.png">image link</a>, with bold at the bottom.
1885     * <br>
1886     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1887     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1888     * <br>
1889     * Needs files:
1890     * <ul>
1891     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1892     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png</li>
1893     * </ul>
1894     * @return the TextFamily object that can represent many sizes of the font Iosevka-Slab.ttf with 4 styles and an MSDF effect
1895     */
1896    public static TextFamily getCrispSlabFamily()
1897    {
1898        initialize();
1899        if(instance.familySlabMSDF == null)
1900        {
1901            try {
1902                instance.familySlabMSDF = new TextFamily();
1903                instance.familySlabMSDF
1904                        .fontMultiDistanceField("Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.fnt", "Iosevka-Slab-Family-msdf.png")
1905                        .setSmoothingMultiplier(1.55f);
1906            } catch (Exception e) {
1907                e.printStackTrace();
1908            }
1909        }
1910        if(instance.familySlabMSDF != null)
1911            return instance.familySlabMSDF.copy();
1912        return null;
1913
1914    }
1915    /**
1916     * Returns a TextFamily already configured to use a variable-width serif font that should look like the serif
1917     * fonts used in many novels' main texts, and that should scale cleanly to many sizes using an MSDF technique, and
1918     * supports 4 styles (regular, bold, italic, and bold italic). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is 
1919     * Noto Serif, which is OFL-licensed by Google, and looks very legible in normal use. Meant to be used in
1920     * variable-width displays like TextPanel.
1921     * <br>
1922     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1.5f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1923     * <br>
1924     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/WsDqSfJ.png">In the foreground message box in ZoneDemo</a>
1925     * <br>
1926     * This creates a TextFamily instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1927     * distance field font technique this uses can work, but it can also be used as a TextCellFactory.
1928     * <br>
1929     * Needs files:
1930     * <ul>
1931     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.fnt</li>
1932     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-Family-msdf.png</li>
1933     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/NotoSerif-license.txt</li>
1934     * </ul>
1935     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Noto Serif, made available by Google
1936     */
1937    public static TextFamily getCrispPrintFamily() {
1938        initialize();
1939        if (instance.familyPrintMSDF == null) {
1940            try {
1941                instance.familyPrintMSDF = new TextFamily();
1942                instance.familyPrintMSDF.fontMultiDistanceField(crispNotoSerif, crispNotoSerifTexture)
1943                        .width(7).height(30).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.5f);
1944                instance.familyPrintMSDF.font().setUseIntegerPositions(false);
1945            } catch (Exception e) {
1946                e.printStackTrace();
1947            }
1948        }
1949        if(instance.familyPrintMSDF != null)
1950            return instance.familyPrintMSDF.copy();
1951        return null;
1952    }
1953    /**
1954     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a partially-angular variable-width font with good Unicode
1955     * support and an appearance as if it were carved into solid rock, that should scale cleanly to even very large
1956     * sizes (using an MSDF technique). Caches the result for later calls. The font used is
1957     * <a href="https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/show/507930/bloccus">Bloccus by Christian Munk</a>. It supports a
1958     * lot of glyphs, including most of extended Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, and the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA),
1959     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
1960     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
1961     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
1962     * <br>
1963     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 1f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
1964     * <br>
1965     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/zaqgHTW.png">Image link</a>
1966     * <br>
1967     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
1968     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
1969     * <br>
1970     * Needs files:
1971     * <ul>
1972     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.fnt</li>
1973     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-msdf.png</li>
1974     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/bloccus-license.txt</li>
1975     * </ul>
1976     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font bloccus.ttf
1977     */
1978    public static TextCellFactory getCrispCarvedFont()
1979    {
1980        initialize();
1981        if(instance.msdfCarved == null)
1982        {
1983            try {
1984                instance.msdfCarved = new TextCellFactory()
1985                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispCarved, crispCarvedTexture)
1986                        .width(7f).height(24f).setSmoothingMultiplier(1.0f);
1987            } catch (Exception e) {
1988                e.printStackTrace();
1989            }
1990        }
1991        if(instance.msdfCarved != null)
1992            return instance.msdfCarved.copy();
1993        return null;
1994    }
1995    /**
1996     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a variable-width sans-serif font with good Unicode support
1997     * and a no-nonsense look, that should scale cleanly to even very large or small sizes (using an MSDF technique).
1998     * Caches the result for later calls. The font used is <a href="https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Roboto">Roboto
1999     * Regular by Christian Robertson</a>. It supports a lot of glyphs, including most Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic,
2000     * but not box drawing characters because this is variable-width. This uses the Multi-channel Signed Distance
2001     * Field (MSDF) technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which gives the rendered font
2002     * sharper edges and precise corners instead of rounded tips on strokes.
2003     * <br>
2004     * Note: Uses a smoothing multiplier of 2f, instead of the default 1.2f. 
2005     * <br>
2006     * Preview: <a href="https://i.imgur.com/ASjdjc6.png">Image link when scaled to a small size</a>
2007     * <br>
2008     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
2009     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
2010     * <br>
2011     * Needs files:
2012     * <ul>
2013     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.fnt</li>
2014     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-Regular-msdf.png</li>
2015     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Roboto-License.txt</li>
2016     * </ul>
2017     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of the font Roboto-Regular.ttf
2018     */
2019    public static TextCellFactory getCrispRobotoSansFont()
2020    {
2021        initialize();
2022        if(instance.msdfRoboto == null)
2023        {
2024            try {
2025                instance.msdfRoboto = new TextCellFactory()
2026                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispRobotoSans, crispRobotoSansTexture)
2027                        .width(3f).height(14f).setSmoothingMultiplier(2f);
2028            } catch (Exception e) {
2029                e.printStackTrace();
2030            }
2031        }
2032        if(instance.msdfRoboto != null)
2033            return instance.msdfRoboto.copy();
2034        return null;
2035    }

2037    /**
2038     * Returns a TextCellFactory already configured to use a fixed-width icon font (no letters are supported) using the
2039     * Font-Awesome icon set, that should scale cleanly to even very large sizes. Caches the result for later calls.
2040     * The icon font used is the popular Font-Awesome free set (solid style), an open-source (SIL Open Font License)
2041     * typeface that is often used online. You will probably want to consult the cheatsheet for what chars are actually
2042     * supported; <a href="https://fontawesome.com/cheatsheet">the cheatsheet is here</a>. This uses the Multi-channel
2043     * Signed Distance Field technique as opposed to the normal Signed Distance Field technique, which should allow
2044     * sharper edges. You may also want the list of all chars in this icon font; {@link #iconFontAll} has that.
2045     * <br>
2046     * Preview: <a href="">Image link</a>
2047     * <br>
2048     * This creates a TextCellFactory instead of a BitmapFont because it needs to set some extra information so the
2049     * multi-channel distance field font technique this uses can work.
2050     * <br>
2051     * Needs files:
2052     * <ul>
2053     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.fnt</li>
2054     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/awesome-solid-msdf.png</li>
2055     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Font-Awesome-license.txt</li>
2056     * </ul>
2057     * @return the TextCellFactory object that can represent many sizes of Font Awesome Free (solid) with an MSDF effect
2058     */
2059    public static TextCellFactory getCrispIconFont()
2060    {
2061        initialize();
2062        if(instance.msdfIcons == null)
2063        {
2064            try {
2065                instance.msdfIcons = new TextCellFactory()
2066                        .fontMultiDistanceField(crispIcons, crispIconsTexture);
2067            } catch (Exception e) {
2068                e.printStackTrace();
2069            }
2070        }
2071        if(instance.msdfIcons != null)
2072            return instance.msdfIcons.copy();
2073        return null;
2074
2075    }

2079    /**
2080     * Gets an image of a (squid-like, for SquidLib) tentacle, 32x32px.
2081     * Source is public domain: http://opengameart.org/content/496-pixel-art-icons-for-medievalfantasy-rpg
2082     * Created by Henrique Lazarini (7Soul1, http://7soul1.deviantart.com/ )
2083     * <br>
2084     * Needs file:
2085     * <ul>
2086     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/Tentacle.png</li>
2087     * </ul>
2088     * @return a TextureRegion containing an image of a tentacle.
2089     */
2090    public static TextureRegion getTentacle()
2091    {
2092        initialize();
2093        if(instance.tentacle == null || instance.tentacleRegion == null)
2094        {
2095            try {
2096                instance.tentacle = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal("Tentacle.png"));
2097                instance.tentacleRegion = new TextureRegion(instance.tentacle);
2098            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2099            }
2100        }
2101        return instance.tentacleRegion;
2102    }

2105    /**
2106     * Gets a TextureAtlas containing many icons with a distance field effect applied, allowing them to be used with
2107     * "stretchable" fonts and be resized in the same way. These will not look as-expected if stretchable fonts are not
2108     * in use, and will seem hazy and indistinct if the shader hasn't been set up for a distance field effect by
2109     * TextCellFactory (which stretchable fonts will do automatically). The one page of the TextureAtlas is 2048x2048,
2110     * which may be too large for some old, low-end Android phones, and possibly integrated graphics with fairly old
2111     * processors on desktop. It has over 2000 icons.
2112     * <br>
2113     * The icons are CC-BY and the license is distributed with them, though the icons are not necessarily included with
2114     * SquidLib. If you use the icon atlas, be sure to include icons-license.txt with it and reference it with your
2115     * game's license and/or credits information.
2116     * <br>
2117     * Needs files:
2118     * <ul>
2119     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.atlas</li>
2120     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons.png</li>
2121     *     <li>https://github.com/yellowstonegames/SquidLib/blob/master/assets/icons-license.txt Needed to credit artists</li>
2122     * </ul>
2123     * @return a TextureAtlas containing over 2000 icons with a distance field effect
2124     */
2125    public static TextureAtlas getIconAtlas()
2126    {
2127        initialize();
2128        if(instance.iconAtlas == null)
2129        {
2130            try {
2131                instance.iconAtlas = new TextureAtlas(Gdx.files.internal("icons.atlas"));
2132            } catch (Exception ignored) {
2133            }
2134        }
2135        return instance.iconAtlas;
2136    }

2138    /**
2139     * This is a static global StatefulRNG that's meant for usage in cases where the seed does not matter and any
2140     * changes to this RNG's state will not change behavior elsewhere in the program; this means the GUI mainly.
2141     */
2142    public static StatefulRNG getGuiRandom()
2143    {
2144        initialize();
2145        if(instance.guiRandom == null)
2146        {
2147            instance.guiRandom =  new StatefulRNG();
2148        }
2149        return instance.guiRandom;
2150    }

2153     * things like analyze hue or saturation of a color.
2154     */
2155    public static SquidColorCenter getSCC()
2156    {
2157        initialize();
2158        if(instance.scc == null)
2159        {
2160            instance.scc =  new SquidColorCenter();
2161        }
2162        return instance.scc;
2163    }

2181                                          "\n" +
2182                                          "\n" +

2192    /**
2193     * All of the Font-Awesome Free (solid style) characters in {@link #getCrispIconFont()}, as a String.
